page.title: 06Wildlife,Lorton/Whinlatter
page.content: Most of this block is covered by fields,fells,trees and streams,so there is a lot of{wildlife,}both {plants}and{animals. There are many common{birds,}such as magpies,jackdaws and swallows,as well as owls,kestrels, buzzards,herons, sparrow-hawks and woodpeckers.By water there are{frogs,newts}and{toads}and on the fells there are{lizards.}There are plenty of{mammals}too,such as weasels, shrews, moles,red squirrels,rabbits, foxes and roe deer. Alongside the roads,in the woods,on the fells,in the fields and by the streams there are many{wild flowers } and in the hedgerows there are many {shrubs}and different kinds of{trees.} These all provide food for a wide variety of{insects,}as well as for the birds and other animals in winter.
